subject: Investing
title: Bitcoin: Digital Gold Explained
description: A fast breakdown of Bitcoin: Digital Gold Explained for builders.

hook.text: In 2009, a pseudonymous creator launched a currency with no government, no CEO, and a hard cap of 21 million coins.

buildup.text: Bitcoin was designed as peer-to-peer electronic cash, but evolved into a digital store of value.

discovery.text: Its fixed supply mirrors gold's scarcity. Halvings cut new issuance every four years, tightening supply over time.

twist.text: Critics call it too volatile to be money. Supporters say volatility is the price of adoption in progress.

climax.text: Institutional adoption, spot ETFs, and sovereign reserves have shifted Bitcoin from fringe to mainstream debate.

punchline.text: Scarcity plus decentralization. That's the Bitcoin thesis in six words.

quiz.question: What is the maximum supply of Bitcoin?
